Agency: Labor Department Wage and Hour Division
Info Source: March 7, 2017 download of a dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division at https://enforcedata.dol.gov/views/data_summary.php
Notes: Date and year are the Findings End Date in the dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division, which does not provide case opening or closing dates. The company name is the Legal Name provided by the dataset unless that field is blank, in which case the Trade Name is used. The dataset provides only one address and does not indicate whether it is the company headquarters address or the establishment address. The penalty amount is the total of civil monetary penalties and mandated back wages. The original dataset provides a breakdown.

Agency: Labor Department Wage and Hour Division

Description: The Consumer Financial Protection Bureau took action against Prospect Mortgage, LLC as it accused the company of paying illegal kickbacks for mortgage business referrals.

The U.S. Department of Housing and Urban Development announced an agreement with Prospect Mortgage, LLC (Prospect) to settle allegations the California-based mortgage lender created sham affiliated business arrangements for the purpose of paying improper kickbacks or referral fees in violation of Federal Housing Administration guidelines and the Real Estate Settlement Procedures Act.  Prospect agreed to dissolve these sham joint ventures and pay $3.1 million to resolve the complaint.

The United States settled civil mortgage fraud claims against Prospect Mortgage Company, LLC stemming from Prospect's participation in the Direct Endorsement Lender Program, which is administered by the Federal Housing Administration and the U.S. Department of Housing and Urban Development.

Prospect Mortgage agreed to pay $1,811,000 administrative fees and approximately $1.33 million in refunds in settlement of allegations it overcharged some borrowers per diem interest, and other violations of state lending regulations.
Agency: California Department of Financial Protection and Innovation
California Department of Financial Protection and Innovation

Description: Prospect Mortgage LLC agreed to pay a $3 million penalty and deliver $427,155 restitution to homeowners after a Department of Financial Services examination uncovered that the company engaged in deceptive practices on interest rates that harmed consumers.
Agency: New York Department of Financial Services

Description: Prospect Mortgage agreed to pay $7.035 million to 48 states and the District of Columbia to resolve litigation brought by state mortgage regulators concerning disclosure deficiences, loan origination irregularities and other issues.
